tk.halfgray.pcommandbot

Class PCommandBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jibble.pircbot.PircBot
      • tk.halfgray.pcommandbot.PCommandBot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReplyConstants

    public class PCommandBot
extends PircBot
    Bot that responds to commands sent through IRC. A bot should be instantiated and then configured using loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader). The configuration may already load certain commands, but additional commands may be registered with getResponders() and getSynonymousCommands().

      • PCommandBot

    • Method Detail

      • loadConfiguration

        public void loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader creader)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Load the configuration for this bot from the given reader. The reader should point to a JSON-encoded object. If there is any error, the configuration is reset.
        Parameters:
        creader - Reader pointing to the configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading the configuration
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there is a problem parsing the configuration from JSON, or if fields are missing
        See Also:
        resetConfiguration()

      • parseConfiguration

        protected void parseConfiguration(java.io.Reader creader)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Parse the configuration.
        Parameters:
        creader - Reader pointing to a JSON-encoded object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading from creader
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the configuration could not be parsed, or if the root value is not a JSON object
        See Also:
        loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)

      • loadFixedCommands

        protected void loadFixedCommands()
        Load fixed commands from the configuration, if the configuration has been parsed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the configuration is not yet parsed
        See Also:
        loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)

        Throws:

        See Also:
        loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)

      • resetConfiguration

        public void resetConfiguration()
        Reset configuration to its initial state. This does not disconnect the bot from the server. The bot can be reconfigured with loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Check if the bot is ready to run. Generally, this means that the configuration has been loaded with loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)
        Returns:
        true if the bot is ready, false otherwise

      • getConfiguredServer

        protected java.lang.String getConfiguredServer()
        Get the server that this bot should connect to
        Returns:
        Server name, or "" if the configuration is not loaded
        See Also:
        loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)

      • getConfiguredPort

        protected int getConfiguredPort()
        Get the port on which this bot should connect. An valid port number is between 1 and 65535 (inclusively); an invalid port number indicates that the default port should be used.
        Returns:
        Port number
        See Also:
        loadConfiguration(java.io.Reader)

      • getUserLists

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getUserLists()
        Get lists of users, as a map of channel names to lists of nicks. These lists should be used to track nicks for processing mentions. All channel names and nicks are lowercase, such that str.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale.ENGLISH).equals(str) returns true.
        Returns:
        Lists of users, as a map
        See Also:
        String.toLowerCase()

      • getResponders

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Responder> getResponders()
        Get the the commands recognized by this bot as a map of command strings to Responder objects. This map can be used to add, remove, and change commands. Command strings are lowercase such that str.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale.ENGLISH).equals(str) returns true.
        Returns:
        Map representing the bot's commands
        See Also:
        String.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale)

      • getSynonymousCommands

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> getSynonymousCommands()
        Get the synonymous commands recognized by this bot as a map of command strings to synonyms (arrays of strings). An invocation of a synonymous command causes each command registered as a synonym to be invoked in turn; nonexistent synonyms are ignored. These synonyms cannot themselves be synonymous commands. This map can be used to add, remove, and change commands. All command strings (in both keys and values)are lowercase such that str.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale.ENGLISH).equals(str) returns true.
        Returns:
        Map representing the bot's synonymous commands
        See Also:
        String.toLowerCase(java.util.Locale)

      • start

        public void start()
           throws NickAlreadyInUseException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  IrcException
        Start the bot. This will connect the bot to the server and listen for commands.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the bot is not ready
        NickAlreadyInUseException - If none of the configured nicks can be used
        java.io.IOException - If the connect() function cannot connect
        IrcException - If the connect() function cannot connect
        See Also:
        isReady(), PircBot.connect(String, int), PircBot.connect(String)

          java.lang.String login,
          java.lang.String hostname)

      • onKick

        protected void onKick(java.lang.String channel,
          java.lang.String kickerNick,
          java.lang.String kickerLogin,
          java.lang.String kickerHostname,
          java.lang.String recipientNick,
          java.lang.String reason)
        Process someone being kicked from a channel. This method is overridden to remove the nick from a list of users for tracking.
        Overrides:
        onKick in class PircBot
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel from which the user was kicked
        kickerNick - User (operator/half-operator) who kicked
        kickerLogin - Login name of the kicker
        kickerHostname - Hostname of the kicker
        recipientNick - User who was kicked
        reason - Reason given for kicking
        See Also:
        PircBot.onKick(String, String, String, String, String, String), getUserLists()

        protected java.lang.String[] getMentions(java.lang.String channel,
                             java.lang.String message)
        Get the nicks mentioned in a message, if any.
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel to which the message was sent
        message - Message text
        Returns:
        Array of mentioned nicks, possibly empty

      • processCommands

        protected java.lang.String[] processCommands(java.lang.String channel,
                                 java.lang.String sender,
                                 java.lang.String message)
        Process any commands in a message into an array of responses.
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel from which the message originated, or null if it was a private message
        sender - Sender of the message
        message - Message text
        Returns:
        Array of responses (with mentions added), possibly empty
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the bot is not ready
        See Also:
        isReady()

      • onMessage

        protected void onMessage(java.lang.String channel,
             java.lang.String sender,
             java.lang.String login,
             java.lang.String hostname,
             java.lang.String message)
        Process potential commands from public messages. Responses to commands that mention other users in the channel will mention the same users.
        Overrides:
        onMessage in class PircBot
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel from which the message was sent
        sender - Sender of the message
        login - Login name of the user
        hostname - Hostname of the user
        message - Message text
        See Also:
        PircBot.onMessage(String, String, String, String, String)
